document.masterDocTitle: Review of Scydmaenus (Geoscydmaenus) of Madagascar (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Scydmaenus (Geoscydmaenus) of Madagascar (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype ( MADAGASCAR )
: ♂ , two labels ( Fig. 1 ): "S-Madagaskar / Massif de l'Isalo / lg. H.Franz 1969" [white, printed] with " Mg 20" handwritten in blue on the reverse side; Scydmaenus / ( Geoscydmaenus ) / isaloensis m. / det. H.Franz " [white, handwritten and printed]; " ♂ " [white, printed]; " Typus " [red, handwritten] ( NHMW )
.
Paratypes :
12 exx., same data as for holotype ( NHMW )
.

Additional material studied: 16 exx., Madagascar , Isalo N.P. , Ananalava forest ,
719-741 m
,
17-18.i.2013
, sifted leaf litter, L.S. Rahanitriniaina & E.M. Rabotoson leg.
;
2 exx., Madagascar , Isalo N.P. , Piscine naturelle,
852 m
,
21.i.2013
, sifted leaf litter, L.S. Rahanitriniaina & E.M. Rabotoson leg.
;
2 exx., Madagascar , Isalo N.P. , Oasis forest ,
894 m
,
20.i.2013
, sifted leaf litter, L.S. Rahanitriniaina & E.M. Rabotoson leg. ( MMBC , cPJ).

Revised diagnosis. Head broadest near posterior margin of vertex, strongly narrowing anteriorly; profemur of male with clavate part strongly convex dorsally and ventrally, with long ventral projection located near middle, its apex hook-shaped; protibia of male abruptly broadened distally and slightly but distinctly curved; aedeagus with deeply notched apex, lateral apical lobes distinctly separated at middle.
Redescription. Body of male ( Fig. 3 ) strongly elongate and slender, strongly flattened, yellowish to light brown and covered with light brown setae; BL 0.76–0.83 mm (mean 0.80 mm ).

Pronotum in dorsal view ( Figs 3–4 ) oval, broadest between middle and anterior third; PL 0.21–0.23 mm (mean 0.22 mm ), PW 0.20–0.23 mm (mean 0.21 mm ). Punctures on pronotal disc shallow and diffused, inconspicuous; setae short, sparse and nearly recumbent.

Elytra ( Fig. 3 ) oval and strongly elongate, broadest near anterior third, EL 0.43–0.45 mm (mean 0.44 mm ), EW 0.25–0.28 mm (mean 0.27 mm ), EI 1.55–1.80. Elytra covered with distinct and dense punctures, which are small and with diffused margins; setae similar to those on pronotum.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Scydmaenus ( Geoscydmaenus )
of Madagascar.
Scydmaenus isaloensis Franz
(1, 3–4) and
Sc. madagassicus Franz
(2, 5–8). Set of original labels of holotype (1–2); dorsal habitus of male (3); head and prothorax in dorsal (4–5) and ventral (6) views; head in ventral (7) and lateral (8) view. Abbreviations: bst, basisternal part of prosternum; fr, frons; gp, gular plate; hr, hypostomal ridge; hy, hypomeron; occ, occipital constriction; ptp, posterior tentorial pit; vt, vertex.

FIGURES 9–11.
Scydmaenus ( Geoscydmaenus )
of Madagascar.
Scydmaenus madagassicus Franz
(9–10) and
Sc. isaloensis Franz
(11). Pterothorax and abdomen in ventral view (9); pterothorax, transparent mount in ventral view (10); profemoral ventral tooth of male in lateral view (11). Abbreviations: aest3, metanepisternum; ar, anterior ridge; lf, lateral fovea; lmfa, lateral metafurcal arm; mscc, mesocoxal cavity; mscs, mesocoxal socket; msvp, mesoventral intercoxal process; mtvc, metaventral carina; mtvp, metaventral intercoxal process; pcr, procoxal rest; pre, prepectus.

subSubSection.paragraph: Aedeagus ( Figs 16–18 , 22–23 ) elongate, AeL 0.20 mm ; median lobe in ventral view with distinctly demarcated apical portion bearing a pair of lateral apical lobes separated at middle by deep notch.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 12–15.
Scydmaenus (
Geoscydmaenus
)
of Madagascar.
Scydmaenus isaloensis
Franz
(12, 14) and
Sc.
madagassicus
Franz
(13, 15). Right antenna of male in dorsal view (12–13); right fore leg of male in anterior view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Similar to male, except for distinctly more slender profemora lacking ventral projections and nearly straight and only slightly, gradually thickened protibiae. BL 0.80–0.83 mm (mean 0.81 mm ); HL 0.13–0.14 mm (mean 0.13 mm ), HW 0.15–0.16 mm (mean 0.15 mm ), AnL 0.35 mm ; PL 0.20–0.21 mm (mean 0.21 mm ), PW 0.18–0.19 mm (mean 0.18 mm ); EL 0.43 mm , EW 0.25–0.26 mm (mean 0.26 mm ), EI 1.62–1.70.
